Summary Online Retailer of Custom, Handcrafted Western style gifts, Sterling Silver Jewelry, Handmade Bits, Ropes, Classic Women's Apparel, Cowboy Hats, Caps, T-Shirts & Sweatshirts, Hand Tooled Leather Journals and Handbags & More! 
 
Courage, commitment, passion and dedication define a special attitude, a mental firmness, a quality and strength that is “spirit”, that is cowgirl. We believe there is a promise that lies within each of us to find that spirit and live with passion, whether you are sitting at a desk in the city or driving cattle on the range. 
 
Horsemanship and fly-fishing are so seemingly different and yet so very much alike. Both are detailed, yet vast, simple yet complicated. The key to each is timing, feel communication, and technique. Success in each is defined individually. 
 
Cowgirl Up & Fly ™ brings them together for you in a weekend get-away. Our Women’s Ride & Fly program is geared for the beginner fishermen and the seasoned trail rider. Now you can experience both and see the magic in each. Small groups makes our Ride & Fly program a relaxing and inspiring weekend. Bring your horse and yourself and we’ll take care of the rest. 
• Peaceful camps tucked away in the trees yet steps away from high mountain lakes,streams and rivers 
• The ultimate in horse camping & trail- riding set against the beauty of different Northern California locations 
• Learn the basics of Fly Fishing ~ the knots ~the cast ~the bugs ~the catch  
• Gourmet meals, evening campfires  
• Easy going and relaxed setting  
• Bring your horse and yourself, we’ll take care of the rest! Specialties:Online Retailer of Custom, Quality Apparel, Cowboy Hats, Hand made bits, One of kind jewelry, Unique western gift items. Experience Owner A Cowgirl's Promise LLC 2008  – Present (7 years) Shingle Springs, CA Our unique collection of handmade bits, sterling silver, turquoise and Navajo jewelry along with conchos, ropes, tools and western home accents offers that one-of-a-kind feel for your home, yourself or as a gift to a friend. 
 
We designed our product line around quality, craftsmanship, and tradition. Our products are simply stated and classically designed. We are dedicated to providing you with top quality, hand crafted, unique products.

Summary Comprehensive experience directing software projects, portfolios, and multi-disciplined teams within telecommunications manufacturers, systems and service provider companies. Adept in creating business strategies for global deployment of large, multi-discipline projects on time and within budget. Heavily involved in new product development process from initial concept through final delivery phase. 
 
Preparation, proposal and justification of large budgets including CAPEX for both product programs and line organization. Led projects through re-scoping and departments through organisational changes. PMP® certified professional since 2007. Experience Project Manager Hewlett-Packard September 2013  – Present (2 years) Volunteer PMP Instructor Project Management Institute 2007  – Present (8 years) sacramento, california area •	Coached and Trained current Project Management Professionals in gaining their PMP®  
•	Voted “Best in Knowledge, Preparedness and Enthusiasm” by students last four years. 
•	Most Requested Instructor for past five years by Leadership Systems Project Manager Intel Corporation November 2012  –  September 2013  (11 months) folsom, ca • Performed Systems Analysis of issue management systems including ProSupport, Intel Premier Support, SalesForce and Service Now 
• Developed business and system “AS-IS” and “TO-BE” Process Flow Charts for Issue Management System 
• Engaged customer to develop RFI for Issue Management System 
• Conducted Feasibility Study including recommendations 
• Delivered presentations to customer and provided next steps to new system 
• Worked with vendors to collect RFI Responses 
• Performed system software testing and validation of issue management tools Project and Operations Manager Koch Kreations November 2007  –  November 2012  (5 years 1 month) lincoln, california • Launched & managed a new startup business 
• Increased Sales Annually; Tripled Sales in Three Years 
• Created Business and Design Concept, Managed 100+ Customer Projects Successfully 
• Managed a Direct Staff of 9 members executing all Business Functions  
• Developed and Managed a Marketing Strategy  
• Style Magazine’s Reader’s Choice Award for Favorite Landscaper in 2009 & 2010. Store Manager and Regional Instructor Starbucks 2003  –  2007  (4 years) Sacramento, California Area •	Responsible for Stores Financial Performance, Product Quality, Customer Satisfaction, Safety and Security. 
•	Increased Sales 12% for store in CA State Office Building. 
•	Increased Sales 27% in West Roseville Store during 2 year period. 
•	Managed New Start-up Store while managing West Roseville Store with continued Sales Growth. 
•	Conducted Training classes for New employees, Supervisors and Store Managers. Project Manager Intel Corporation 2000  –  2003  (3 years) Sacramento, California Area •	Managed the developing a trade secret Software Application implemented to Share top secret designs between Business Partners. 
•	Managed Software Vendor relationships including Licensing and Software Change Request. 
•	Managed Build of a Highly Secured Data Center used to store top secret electronic data for Intel. 
•	Led Benchmark Study with 13 other Companies providing Intel with a 2-year Info Security Roadmap. 
•	Managed Software Development from Initiation through Closing Processes using PMBOK Best Practices as adopted by the Project Management Institute. 
•	Managed Software Development using the SDLC process. Business Analyst II Packad Bell NEC 1998  –  2000  (2 years) Sacramento, California Area •	Assisted in the Design and Implementation of an Online Batch Custom PC Order System for Circuit City Store’s National Kiosk Program. 
•	Managed Software Development Project to Reduce warranty turnaround time to customers by 28%  
•	Increased Customer Fulfilment Time by 35% by Providing Analysis, System Change Request and Testing. 
•	Designed and Implemented a Freight Cycle Time Process Reducing Freight Cost. Summary Strategic IT Project Manager and Program Manager with a record of driving excellence by engineering need-focused, complex solutions that deliver immediate impact and sustainable improvements in the networking and telecom industries. Success in aligning technical strategies with mission-critical needs through high-profile project management initiatives and technology process improvements. Resourceful and proactive leader who acts as a change agent, with a history of establishing best-in-class operations. Adept at balancing competing resources and encouraging top performance from cross-functional teams. Bilingual English and Vietnamese. Core competencies include:  
 Product Development  
 System Design  
 Project & Program Management  
 Risk Assessment  
 Quality Improvement 
 Deployments & Migrations  
 Project Planning & Execution

Resourceful and proactive leader who acts as a change agent, with a history of establishing best-in-class operations. Adept at balancing competing resources and encouraging top performance from cross-functional teams. Bilingual English and Vietnamese. Core competencies include:  
 Product Development  
 System Design  
 Project & Program Management  
 Risk Assessment  
 Quality Improvement 
 Deployments & Migrations  
 Project Planning & Execution

IT Factory Project Manager Intel Corporation January 2010  –  December 2010  (1 year) Ireland ‣ Assumed complete ownership of online inventory ordering application, WoW, minimising throughput time. 
‣ Headed team tasked with identifying business unit requirements and evaluating the existing supply chain. 
‣ Inducted business stakeholders in Scrum methodology to optimise product delivery over iterative release. 
‣ Translated Scrum data into development group task items, resulting in functional components for testing. 
‣ Eradicated stockroom's constraint on permitting factory technicians to see less expensive available parts. 
‣ Assembled WoW rollout strategy, supporting readiness activities through pilot runs and feedback sessions. 
‣ Created per-site deployment prerequisites for all Intel factories across USA, Israel, Malaysia, and Ireland. 
‣ Authored instructional content based on user interaction observations and site-specific knowledge needs.  
‣ Employed standardised templates to capture process changes, tool adoption metrics, and business value.  
‣ Introduced centralised information storage systems and aligned documents to ease management reviews. 
‣ Ran new ordering system concurrent with old as a failsafe measure; guided deprecated tool towards EOL. IT Cost Systems Project Manager Intel Corporation July 2009  –  December 2009  (6 months) Ireland Designed, developed and implemented 'one-stop-shop' for commodity spend across Intel factory network. 
Defined single data source for equipment purchase and consumption reports in tandem with stakeholders. 
Assembled prototypes of high-level indicators, tactical indicators, and granular transactions information. 
Trained project resources in associated database architecture necessary to manipulate data for reporting. 
Rolled updated system out internationally to cost managers, assisting rapid identification of spend issues. Factory Systems Project Manager Intel Corporation January 2008  –  June 2009  (1 year 6 months) Ireland Built a solution to facilitate direct Systems Group access to factory automation Decision Support Systems. 
Prepared prototypes during the requirements gathering phase, sharing with representatives of each plant. 
Introduced centralised, standardised application for generation of manufacturing performance indicators. 
Eliminated up to 26 hours per week of indicator and report administration/maintenance via automations. 
Produced visual documentation to accelerate global cross-training and ongoing improvement endeavours. 
Set standard business processes and work instructions needed to record and track time saving LEAN wins. Coordinated quarterly preventative maintenance goal definition process, decreasing PM durations by 70%. 
Organised execution of High Precision Maintenance Reports in service of improved machine performance. 
Constructed performance indicator reports suite, promoting attainment of 90% equipment uptime target. 
Authored and sustained Tactical Operation Preventative Maintenance Trackers critical to line productivity. 
Programmed push-button report on factory and area performance against schedule for the module teams. 
Instructed Intel U class in Visual Basic, elevating the group's proficiency in developing automated reports. 
Proliferated solution among Intel Network counterparts, incorporating lessons learned back into Irish site.
